text: Shih Chun-jen (; 2 December 1923 – 18 June 2017) was a Taiwanese neurosurgeon. He led the Department of Health from 1986 to 1990. Shih was appointed the head surgeon at Tri-Service General Hospital, a medical institution affiliated with the National Defense Medical Center, in 1975. Two years later, he co-founded the Taiwan Neurological Society. He was born in Gosei, Taikō, Taichū Prefecture, Taiwan, Empire of Japan. Shih died of a heart attack at a hospital in Taipei on 18 June 2017, aged 93. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Neurosurgeons Category:Taiwanese politicians
title: Shih Chun-jen
